member.summary: Gets or sets rendering options for ViewXY. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.RenderOptionsCommon.DeviceType
member.summary: Gets or sets rendering device type. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.RenderOptionsCommon.ForceDeviceCreateOnResize
member.summary: Gets or sets if force device create on control resize. Some virtual machine environment require this to be set to true. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.RenderOptionsCommon.GPUPreference
member.summary: Gets or sets GPU preference setting. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.RenderOptionsCommon.HeadlessMode
member.summary:
Defines if the LightningChart expects to have a graphical interface or not. This allows the LC to be used in the background, without connections to interface.
This has effect on multiple different things. For instance device type selection will cause the engine to change instantly on selection, not when LC is connected to visual tree.
member.remarks:
Note that this represents the user selection for the headlessnes. Running in service will cause the headlessnes to be forced on.
Also note that only DX11 supports headless mode. DX9 will not work in headless mode.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.RenderOptionsCommon.FrameRateLimit
member.summary:
Maximum frames to present in second.
This is a dependency property

remarks.para: This system can be used to limit the FPS of the chart to certain amount of frames per second. The limitation is not exact. Limiting will reserve CPU and GPU usage for other purposes. If no limitation is used, chart will try to update itself synchronousely on every change that requires update, like on property changes, data insertion etc.
Note that BeginUpdate and EndUpdate methods should be used when updating properties to prevent unnecessary updates.
This variable controls only the time between frames. The system must be enabled seprately through FrameLimiting property.
Value must be larger than 0. The maximum time between frames is one second, so in effect the FPS can not be limited below one FPS.

member.name: T:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.View3D.Camera3D
member.summary:
Camera in 3D.
Location and orientation
Cameara location and orientation in is defined in relation to the target by RotationX, RotationY and RotationZ properties. RotationX and RotationY properties define the camera location as euler angles, with order X-Y. RotationZ defines camera orientation by defining up-direction as rotation around rotated worlds Z-axis (on XY plane), with 0 rotation producing up direction of Y=1, X=0.
The possible values can be limited by the use of RotationXMinimum and RotationXMaximum properties for X axis rotation, and the respective properties for Y and Z axis.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.View3D.Camera3D.m_vUp
member.summary: Worlds UP direction vector. In effect, controlled through Z-property.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.View3D.Camera3D.m_vLocation
member.summary: Camera location in relation to.area center (m_Target)

member.summary: Flag to disable matrix updates. Usefull for internal euler angle modifications.

member.summary: Clean up any resources being used.
member.param: true if managed resources should be disposed, otherwise false.

member.summary: Same as setting RotationX, RotationY and RotationZ properties separately. Allows easier setting of the properties and is faster than separate setting of the properties.
member.remarks: Note that using this the property change events come before actual view changes.

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.View3D.Camera3D.Rotate(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Rotates the camera with given amounts of Vertical and Horizontal angles. The values are in the direction of the screen without the roll (Z-property), and converted to object space in this method.
member.param: Horizontal rotation in degrees. Negative to left.
Vectical rotation in degrees. Negative to down.

member.summary: can be used to notify camera that the rotation cycle has ended (button has been raised etc.)

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.View3D.Camera3D.SetCamLocation(SharpDX.Mathematics.Vector3,System.Boolean,SharpDX.Mathematics.Vector3)
member.summary: Sets camera location. Sets the X and Y rotation properties based on given camera direction and calclulates the Z rotation from ReverseUp parmater and current Z-rotation property.
member.remarks: Causes a single ChildPropertyChanged call and view matrix recalculation. Will skip the "normal" view matrix generation if the properties do not produce valid enough result.
member.param: the new location of the camera
the new UP direction of the camera

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.View3D.Camera3D.CamLocationToXYZ(SharpDX.Mathematics.Vector3)
member.summary: Converts camera location, target and up vectors back to X and Y properties that produce the same values.
member.remarks: Note that the returned value is not really Vector, just a tuplet of floats.
member.returns: Camera rotation parameters matching the given values as a list of doubles. The order of the parameters is X, Y, Z, in radians. There are allways 3 valud in the list.

member.name: T:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.View3D.FrameBox
member.summary: On View3D a certain area is selected that axes are shown around. In effect the axes form a cube that the axes are drawn on three edges of. The area is further specified by drawing walls on some of it's faces. The area can also be visualized by drawing a framebox around it. The FrameBox consists of lines drawng along the edges of the cube.

remarks.para: Visibility fo the FrameBox can be controlled using the Style property.
To show only the Framebox, set all walls visibility to false.
Unlike most LC objects, this can be shared between different parents.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.View3D.FrameBox.m_eStyleDefault
member.summary: Default value of the style property.

member.summary: Internal storage of the Style propery, se by m_eStyle.

member.summary: Clean up any resources being used.
member.param: true if managed resources should be disposed, otherwise false.

remarks.para: This is a property, even though the name. The idea is that usually we have had separate internal variable with this kind of name, and SetLineColor() method for internal setting of the value. Now these have been combined to this property, so that we do not need separate setter method.
The actual data is stored in m_iLineColorInt variable.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.View3D.FrameBox.m_eStyle
member.summary: Internal property hoding the style definining how to present the FrameBox. When the value changes, set this. Handles internal setting. Not the DP setting though.

remarks.para: This is a property, even though the name. The idea is that usually we have had separate internal variable with this kind of name, and SetXXX() method for internal setting of the value. Now these have been combined to this property, so that we do not need separate setter method.
Internal value is stored in m_iStyleInt variable.

Style that defines how the FrameBox is presented.
This is a DependencyProperty

member.summary: Style to present the framebox with.

member.summary: Framebox is shown on all of the edges of the cube.

member.name: T:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.View3D.FrameBoxObject
member.summary: Drawable caching object that helds one framebox object to be drawn on screen.

remarks.para: This is part of a test for implementing shareable object support for LC. This is the actually drawn object, that can't be shared, The FrameBox object is the one that can be shared and that contains the user controllable settings that notifies this one of changed settings and this one checks the FrameBox for settings when generating DD. This also needs the dimension information from the view, and dirtying of the DD based on those changes is done throu setDirty() interface.

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.View3D.View3D.SortingDirty
member.summary: Virtual method that is called when walls sorting becomes dirty. Before this the sorting dirtynes was kept (and still is) using m_bSortingDirty. We need to know when the sorting becomes dirty so that we can mark the FrameBox dirty, as there is is little point doing the check on every frame.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.View3D.View3D.m_frameBox
member.summary: Property for the UI side Settings object of the FrameBox. On set makes sure that the FrameBoxObject has references to the new settings object. This in turn removes the ref from the old one, marks the DD as dirty and causes new frame to be rendered.

remarks.para: Done like this, as a property, mainly for testing / showing as an option. Usually on LC we have the variable as internal, freely accessible by all, and SetXXXX method for setting the value, that does things that needs to be done when it's set. This one combines those two, and the setter does the things normally done in the SetXXXX method. This way the internal variable is harder (not impossible) to modify without the updates. The actual underlying variable is m_frameBoxInt.
The setter is currently set to private, as currently there should be no need for anybody else to modify the object ref.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.ViewRound.ViewRoundBase.m_fZoomScale
member.summary: Current zooming scale. 1 scales the circle to fit to the margins reduced view area. Acts as a factor for the diameter, meaning larger values causes larger circles.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.ViewRound.ViewRoundBase.m_pucZoomCenter
member.summary: Center of the view in UnitCircle coordinates in relation to the circle center. User controlled property that the user can use to position the view.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.ViewRound.ViewRoundBase.m_ViewSize
member.summary: Last reported size of the view area. Stored in SizeChanged() method, read from chart. Value in actual pixels.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.ViewRound.ViewRoundBase.m_MarginArea
member.summary: View area inside the defined margins in PX (not DIPs). Precalculated from m_ViewSize and margins.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.ViewRound.ViewRoundBase.m_MarginCenter
member.summary: Precalculated center of the margin area in PX, not DIPs.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.ViewRound.ViewRoundBase.m_DiameterNaturalPx
member.summary: Unscaled / natural diameter of the view in PX. Updated on view size changes.
member.remarks: Affected by margins and view size. Calculated from m_MarginArea.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.ViewRound.ViewRoundBase.m_ContentDiameter
member.summary: Diameter of the circle contents (scaled) in PX.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.ViewRound.ViewRoundBase.m_Radius
member.summary: Radius of the content, m_ContentDiameter/2 precalculated as _FLOAT_ in PX. stored as float as we usually need it as float.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.ViewRound.ViewRoundBase.m_pfDrawCenter
member.summary: Current center of the circle in screen pixels.
member.remarks: This is the stored value we actually use in the drawing.

member.summary: Start coordinate of the panning in screen coordinates. Used to calculate vector the mouse has moved.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.ViewRound.ViewRoundBase.m_PanStartZP
member.summary: DrawCenter at the start of panning. Used to calculate the new center point during panning.

member.summary: Defines if the panning threshold has been exceeded and the panning is allowed.

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.ViewRound.ViewRoundBase.FixZoomRectFromMouseLocations(System.Drawing.RectangleF@)
member.summary: Modifies the rect for the use in zooming calculations. Makes proper aspect ratio corrections to a rect, forces it to have positive size, and takes m_bRectangleZoomAboutOrigin into account.

remarks.para: The returned rect's size is allways positive in both directions. The start point corner can not be determined from the rect alone. This is due the use of the rect in drawing operations, where the contents get culled otherwise.
The aspect ratio following allways modifies the StopX or StopY parameter, not the start point, unless the ZoomCenteredOnOrigin (etc) is enabled.
The input rect's size CAN BE NEGATIVE in either direction.

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.ViewRound.ViewRoundBase.FixAspectRatio(System.Drawing.RectangleF@,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Fixes aspect ratio to match the view aspect ratio. Keeps X,Y coords if Center property is false (default), negative sizes allowed (suggestged in some cases). Does not reduce the rect size, only increases it.
member.remarks: Center property can be used to increase the size on both directions.
member.param: If true, keep the rect center in place. Ohtherwise the X/Y is kept in place (which is not necessarilly the left/top)
Increases the size same amount on both directions.

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.ViewRound.ViewRoundBase.UpdateCursor(Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.MouseItemBase)

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.ViewSmith.GridLine.#ctor(Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.ViewSmith.GridLineTree,Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.ViewSmith.GridLineType,Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.ViewSmith.GridLine,System.Double,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gridline constructor. Not that even thought this takes the tree reference, one must still add the item to some node (GridLine) as child for the item to be entered into the tree.

member.summary: Generates inverse gridline over X axis. Applicaple only for imaginary lines.

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.ViewSmith.GridLine.InverseY
member.summary: Inverses basic settings as inverse over X axix. Applicaple only for imaginary lines. Note that the angles of the line must be positive. Othwerwise fix this method.

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.ViewSmith.GridLine.UpdateCircleData
member.summary: Update initial arc definitions, radius and center

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.ViewSmith.GridLine.CalcRad
member.summary: Calculates the radius of the circle/arc in "UC" values. To get the actual screen coordinate distance, multiply with the radius of the axis.

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.ViewSmith.GridLine.CalcCenter
member.summary: Calculates the center of the arc/circle in UC coords. Call evrey time the arc radius (in UC) changes.

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.ViewSmith.GridLine.UpdateInitialPoints
member.summary: Updates UC values of StartPoint, EndPoint and CirclePoint. Needs to be called after CutPoint (value) changes.

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.ViewSmith.GridLine.UpdateInitialAngles
member.summary: Updates initial Start / End angles. No view limitation made yet, based just on Start-/EndPoint. Call if initial Start/end points change. Updates the current start/end angles as well.

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.ViewSmith.GridLine.ViewRectOptimizeInternal(System.Drawing.RectangleF)
member.summary: Updates the arc definitions based on the view rect, to reduce the amount of drawing.
member.remarks: Current implementation of the ClipToCircle is not really that good.

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.ViewSmith.GridLine.AddChild(System.Double,System.Int32)
member.summary: Internall child addition to the tree. The new gridline is of inverse type than this, with given value. Does not set the child level. That must be set by the caller.

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.ViewSmith.GridLine.AddInverseChild(Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.ViewSmith.GridLine)
member.summary: Creates a new inverse child gridline of the given imaginary line. Can not be called for real lines. Uses given lines values for determining the initial angles and points so we do not need to actually calculate them. The given child must have it's values already calculated.

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.ViewSmith.GridLine.Intersection(System.Double)
member.summary: Calculates an intersection with this circle and a circle of iverse type of the given normed smith value. Returned value in screen coordinates.
member.returns: Screen coordinates of the intersection of the two circles.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.ViewSmith.GridLine.CutPoint
member.summary: Point where the line is cut, set by DetermiGridLinePoints. It is the point where this circle crosses with parent -> We can recalculate it here as well.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.ViewSmith.GridLineTree.m_bRadChanged
member.summary: Defines if the changed radius has been taken into account in calculations.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.ViewSmith.GridLineTree.m_dLimitFactor
member.summary: Factor of the given limit distance for determining the cutpoint. Cutting distance C is calculated by C = F*S + I, where I is this, S = m_dLimitDistance and F = m_dLimitFactor.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.ViewSmith.GridLineTree.m_dLimitInc
member.summary: Increment to the cutting disntance. Cutting distance C is calculated by C = F*S + I, where I is this, S = m_dLimitDistance and F = m_dLimitFactor.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.ViewSmith.GridLineTree.m_dLimitDistance
member.summary: Average distance of the gridlines where they are furthest away from each others.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.ViewSmith.GridLineTree.m_dLimitSkip
member.summary: Number of gridline levels to skip when searching for next lines endpoint.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.ViewSmith.GridLineTree.m_bClipToCircle
member.summary: Defines if the lines are to be clipped in to the circle area or not.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.ViewSmith.GridLineTree.m_bNormedValues
member.summary: Defines if the system uses normed or absolute values. Makes difference in value rounding

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.ViewSmith.GridLineTree.m_bValuesDirty
member.summary: Defines if the value calculations needs to be remade.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.ViewSmith.GridLineTree.AllowViewOptimization
member.summary: Defines if the View optimization is allowed.

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.ViewSmith.GridLineTree.Reset(System.Double)
member.summary: Resets the tree. Removes all other items, except roots. Those are set with new values.

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.ViewSmith.GridLineTree.GetCustomGridLines(Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.ViewSmith.GridLineType,System.Drawing.RectangleF)
member.summary: list of current visible custom gridlines.

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.ViewSmith.GridLineTree.InsertChild(Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.ViewSmith.GridLine)
member.summary: Tree internal insert to lists. DO NOT CALL THIS FROM OUTSIDE THE GridLine class!
member.param: Child to add to the list.

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.ViewSmith.GridLineTree.UpdateLines(System.Drawing.RectangleF)
member.summary: Updates all the lines. If required, resets the whole tree and recalculates the line positions, if not, just updates the values.
member.param: View rect to limit the lines to.

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.ViewSmith.GridLineTree.DetermiGridLinePoints
member.summary: Recalculates normal gridline positions and their cutpoint. Resets the tree.
member.remarks: Currently this might be REALLY slow, if we've zoomed in too close. There is lots of calculations to be made.. Some of the results could be cached, some not.

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.ViewSmith.GridLineTree.NextValueCandidate(System.Double)
member.summary: Calculate candidate value for the next gridlines. Calculates the possible next values for img and real components and selects the larger one.
member.remarks: Uses m_dRad (radius), m_dLimitDistance, Previous value and last img. line's properties as source data.
member.param: Previously used value. Could be fetched, but little nuicance to set here.

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.ViewSmith.GridLineTree.RoundValue(System.Double,System.Double,System.String@)
member.summary: Rounds the given value to some nice value based on previous and estimated next value.
member.remarks: Uses previous value, m_dRad (Radius) and m_dLimitDistance fields as input.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.ViewSmith.GridLineTree.RefValue
member.summary: Reference value. Tracked only so that we know when to recalculate positions

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.ViewSmith.GridLineTree.LimitFactor
member.summary: Factor of the given limit distance for determining the cutpoint. Cutting distance C is calculated by C = F*S + I, where I is this, S = m_dLimitDistance and F = m_dLimitFactor.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.ViewSmith.GridLineTree.LimitInc
member.summary: Increment to the cutting disntance. Cutting distance C is calculated by C = F*S + I, where I is this, S = m_dLimitDistance and F = m_dLimitFactor.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.ViewSmith.GridLineTree.LimitDistance
member.summary: Average distance of the gridlines where they are furthest away from each others.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.ViewSmith.GridLineTree.LimitSkip
member.summary: Number of gridline levels to skip when searching for next lines endpoint.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.ViewSmith.GridLineTree.ClipToCircle
member.summary: Defines if the lines are to be clipped in to the circle area or not.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.ViewSmith.GridLineTree.NormedValues
member.summary: Number of gridline levels to skip when searching for next lines endpoint.

member.summary: Gets or sets if auto Y fit is done for all Y axes. This is a dependency property. If this is not set, auto Y fit targets only Y axes having AllowAutoYFit true.

member.summary: Gets or sets margin in percents of min...max range. This is a dependency property. Using some margin leaves a gap between series and axis minimum and maximum values.

member.summary: Gets or sets if auto Y scale update interval in milliseconds. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.ViewXY.AutoYFit.Thorough
member.summary: Gets or sets if all series point in visible X range are searched. This is a dependency property. By using thorough detect method, all series point in visible X range are searched, resulting to accurate fitting, but with cost of extra CPU load. If the detection is not thorough, fitting is not always accurate in real-time monitoring usage.

member.name: T:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.ViewXY.PersistentSeriesRenderingLayer
member.summary: Persistent series rendering layer. Series can be rendered in a bitmap layer and the actual series freed. Saves a lot of memory, CPU and GPU resources, especially when rendering hundreds or thousands of series. The layer itself is rendered in the chart just before line series objects.
member.example: Consider a typical use case of FFT monitoring, where one data line series is collected periodically and added in the layer in full. The layer shows historic information of thousands of FFT strips. By using the persistent series layer, each series has millions of points, and the dozens of new strips can be added every second. By freeing the series itself after rendering it to the layer, the total memory consumption does not rise, and the system won't run out of memory even if the monitoring lasts several weeks.

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.ViewXY.PersistentSeriesRenderingLayer.#ctor(Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.ViewXY.ViewXY,Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Axes.AxisX)
member.param: X axis, whose series will be used in this layer

member.example: MultiplyAlpha(0.8) sets the alpha to 80% of existing alpha (decay). MultiplyAlpha(2) would adjust it to 200% (more visible).

member.summary: Unable to allocate memory for operation. You should run the garbage collection GC.Collect(), and then try the operation again

member.summary: Invalid property value has been set

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.ErrorType.RenderDeviceIsLost
member.summary: Render device is not available anymore

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.ErrorType.RenderInvalidCall
member.summary: Rendering caused invalid call exception. Possibly caused by updating chart from a separate thread without synchronizing it with main program thread. You should use BeginInvoke or Invoke methods for synchronization.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.ErrorType.RenderDeviceSurfaceHasWrongSize
member.summary: The renderer created a drawing surface whose size does not match the parent control's client size.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.ErrorType.InvalidSeriesResolverDataWithSeriesEventMarker
member.summary: Series data X coordinate to Y coordinate resolver data has become invalid, because points have been added. Do not use markers as 'TrackSeries' with X axis monitoring monitoring scroll modes. Instead, you should define them as 'AtYValue' and convert them 'TrackSeries' when opening data in review mode, and set the scroll mode to 'None'.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.ErrorType.SeriesIsNotTrackable
member.summary: You are requesting a tracking operation on a series, that is not trackable (does not implement ITrackable)

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.ErrorType.SampleFormatMismatch
member.summary: Samples use different format than you try to use

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.ErrorType.DataPointTypeMismatch
member.summary: Series has been configured to use different data point type than you are trying to use

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.ErrorType.FastVertexFormatIsNotSupported
member.summary: Fast vertices data is tried to be used, but current graphics adapter does not support them.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.ErrorType.InvalidLogAxisOperation
member.summary: The selected feature can't be used with logarithmic axis

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.ErrorType.ShaderModel3NotSupported
member.summary: Shader model 3 is not supported by the GPU some parts of the chart are cannot drawn as intended.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.ErrorType.BeginUpdateEndUpdateCallCountMismatch
member.summary: EndUpdate() is called more often than BeginUpdate().

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.ErrorType.InvalidSaveFileFormat
member.summary: Invalid save file format. E.g. one can only save XY graph as vector.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.ErrorType.DataBindingCollectionMisuse
member.summary: IsBindableDataUsed is 'true' but non-bindable data collection (e.g. PointLineSeries.Points) is modified instead of bindable data collection (e.g. PointLineSeries.PointsWpf).

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.ErrorType.InvalidAxisIndexForSeries
member.summary: Axis index for axis related item is invalid.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.ErrorType.InvalidSegmentForYAxis
member.summary: Segment or segment index for y-axis is invalid.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.ErrorType.InvalidOwnerViewForItem
member.summary: Item view differs from drawing view.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.ErrorType.FrontBufferAvailable
member.summary: Fast WPF presentation element has retrieved the front buffer, and normal presentation of the LC can continue.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.ErrorType.FrontBufferNotAvailable
member.summary: Fast WPF presentation element has lost the front buffer, and LC cannot be presented using it. This can happen for multiple different valid and normal reasons, like hiding of the window, changing to differnet tab, using through remote desktop, etc, and usually does not require attention. After this the chart will try to use slower fallback presentation method.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.ErrorType.SharpDXBufferCreationError
member.summary: Error on creation of SharpDX Buffer

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.ErrorType.RequirementsNotMet
member.summary: Some of the requirements are not met. Details might present more information.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.ErrorType.LicensingError
member.summary: Problem with licensing. Make sure the license is properly installed.
member.remarks: If you are entitled to use LightningChart, please contact Arction LTD and include the contained detailed error string in the message.

Defines a type for messages that can be received from the rendering engine.
Usually the messages are warnings or other notifications intended for optimization and debugging. If they are criticl they usually result in exceptions.
